p: We tested the efficacy of 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV in maternal vaccination in A129 mice. Ten- to twelve-week-old pregnant A129 mice were subcutaneously immunized with 10 3 FFU 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV at E0.5 (Fig. 2a). High neutralizing antibody titers of ~1/13,200 ± 1700 were detected at E10.5 (Fig. 2b). After subcutaneously challenged with 10 6 PFU Puerto Rico ZIKV strain (PRVABC59) at E10.5, the PBS placebo group developed 8.9 × 10 5 PFU/ml viremia at E12.5, whereas no viremia was detected from the 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV group (Fig. 2c). At E18.5, infectious virus was recovered from maternal spleen (50%), brain (83%), placenta (100%), and fetal brain (8%) from the placebo group; whereas no virus was detected in any organs from the 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV-vaccinated animals (Fig. 2d-g). In addition, 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV vaccination also prevented fetal weight loss (Fig. 2h-i). Compared with the neutralizing antibody titers detected at E10.5 (Fig. 2b), ZIKV challenge did not increase the maternal neutralizing titers at E18.5 (Fig. 2j), indicating that the pregnant mice had achieved sterilizing immunity after vaccination. In addition, high maternal neutralizing antibody titers (1/2,600 ± 600) were detected in the fetuses from the vaccinated dams (Fig. 2k).
